title: Last QE PR generates an incorrect conflct for intel-mkl

labels.name: triage
labels.description: The issue needs to be prioritized

body:
@tz-rrze @adamjstewart 

In the last PR on QE, this change was made:
https://github.com/spack/spack/pull/15276/commits/5811e34f43907d9e7ec46866f2862721a6ed826b

But now QE falsely thinks that there is a conflict:
```
(flake8) [naromero@naromero-desktop packages (QMCPACK_PPCONVERT)]$ spack spec quantum-espresso ^intel-mkl
Input spec
--------------------------------
quantum-espresso
    ^intel-mkl

Concretized
--------------------------------
==> Error: Conflicts in concretized spec "quantum-espresso@6.5%gcc@8.3.0~elpa~epw hdf5=none +mpi~openmp+patch patches=b1aa3179ee1c069964fb9c21f3b832aebeae54947ce8d3cc1a74e7b154c3c10f +scalapack arch=linux-ubuntu18.04-westmere/m6bo4iu"

List of matching conflicts for spec:

    quantum-espresso@6.5%gcc@8.3.0~elpa~epw hdf5=none +mpi~openmp+patch patches=b1aa3179ee1c069964fb9c21f3b832aebeae54947ce8d3cc1a74e7b154c3c10f +scalapack arch=linux-ubuntu18.04-westmere
        ^intel-mkl@2019.0.117%gcc@8.3.0~ilp64+shared threads=none arch=linux-ubuntu18.04-westmere
        ^openmpi@3.1.5%gcc@8.3.0~cuda+cxx_exceptions fabrics=none ~java~legacylaunchers~memchecker~pmi schedulers=none ~sqlite3~thread_multiple+vt arch=linux-ubuntu18.04-westmere
            ^hwloc@1.11.11%gcc@8.3.0~cairo~cuda~gl+libxml2~nvml+pci+shared arch=linux-ubuntu18.04-westmere
                ^libpciaccess@0.13.5%gcc@8.3.0 arch=linux-ubuntu18.04-westmere
                    ^libtool@2.4.6%gcc@8.3.0 arch=linux-ubuntu18.04-westmere
                        ^m4@1.4.18%gcc@8.3.0 patches=3877ab548f88597ab2327a2230ee048d2d07ace1062efe81fc92e91b7f39cd00,fc9b61654a3ba1a8d6cd78ce087e7c96366c290bc8d2c299f09828d793b853c8 +sigsegv arch=linux-ubuntu18.04-westmere
                            ^libsigsegv@2.12%gcc@8.3.0 arch=linux-ubuntu18.04-westmere
                    ^pkgconf@1.6.3%gcc@8.3.0 arch=linux-ubuntu18.04-westmere
                    ^util-macros@1.19.1%gcc@8.3.0 arch=linux-ubuntu18.04-westmere
                ^libxml2@2.9.9%gcc@8.3.0~python arch=linux-ubuntu18.04-westmere
                    ^libiconv@1.16%gcc@8.3.0 arch=linux-ubuntu18.04-westmere
                    ^xz@5.2.4%gcc@8.3.0 arch=linux-ubuntu18.04-westmere
                    ^zlib@1.2.11%gcc@8.3.0+optimize+pic+shared arch=linux-ubuntu18.04-westmere
                ^numactl@2.0.12%gcc@8.3.0 arch=linux-ubuntu18.04-westmere
                    ^autoconf@2.69%gcc@8.3.0 arch=linux-ubuntu18.04-westmere
                        ^perl@5.30.1%gcc@8.3.0+cpanm+shared+threads arch=linux-ubuntu18.04-westmere
                            ^gdbm@1.18.1%gcc@8.3.0 arch=linux-ubuntu18.04-westmere
                                ^readline@8.0%gcc@8.3.0 arch=linux-ubuntu18.04-westmere
                                    ^ncurses@6.2%gcc@8.3.0~symlinks+termlib arch=linux-ubuntu18.04-westmere
                    ^automake@1.16.1%gcc@8.3.0 arch=linux-ubuntu18.04-westmere

1. "^mkl+ilp64" conflicts with "quantum-espresso" [Quantum ESPRESSO does not support MKL 64-bit integer variant]
```
I think the change was made because intel parallel studio is also a mkl provider. Is this an issue with the concretizer, the way the conflict is expressed or something else.
